Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game is the class that controls the logical aspects of the game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Questions> allQuestions  
      private static int howManyRounds  
      private static int numberOfQuestions

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Game​(java.lang.String onePlayerMode, java.lang.String towPlayerMode)
      The constructor initializes the variables for the two files that store the scores and reads the file that contains the questions.

      Changes the score of all the players depending on the type of round they are currently playing.

      Returns all the variables in a player that were changed after each question temporarily to their default state.

      When the game ends, this method gets the list of the players and saves their scores in the file if needed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game​(java.lang.String onePlayerMode,
            java.lang.String towPlayerMode)
        The constructor initializes the variables for the two files that store the scores and reads the file that contains the questions.
        Parameters:
        onePlayerMode - name of file for the one player mode
        towPlayerMode - name of file for the tow player mode

    • Method Detail

      • readScores

        public void readScores()
        The information from the files that store the scores get loaded and ready to be accessed.

      • getHighScores

        public java.lang.String[] getHighScores()
        Returns:
        a String array with all the saved high scores from the file.

      • getTotalWins

        public java.lang.String[] getTotalWins()
        Returns:
        a String array with all of the two-player game scores.

      • randomizeQuestions

        public void randomizeQuestions()
        The questions are rearranged in a random order.

      • getNumberOfQuestions

        public int getNumberOfQuestions()
        Returns:
        the fixed number of questions for each round.

      • getHowManyRounds

        public int getHowManyRounds()
        Returns:
        the fixed number of rounds for the game.

      • getRandomType

        public Type getRandomType​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> playerList)
        Parameters:
        playerList - an array list of players
        Returns:
        selects an acceptable random type, depending on the game mode (1-player, 2-player), for the round creates and returns the analogue object.

      • getNewQuestion

        public Questions getNewQuestion()
        Returns:
        the next question from the arrayList of random questions

      • setStatuses

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> setStatuses​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> answers,
                                               java.lang.String correctAnswer,
                                               java.util.ArrayList<Player> playerList)
        This method accepts the list of the playing users, the list with their answers and the correct answer for the question that was asked and set the status of the players that answered correctly to true.
        Parameters:
        answers - an arrayList of Strings which are the answers that were clicked by the players.
        correctAnswer - the String with the right answer for the question that was asked.
        playerList - the list of the players that are currently playing.
        Returns:
        the list of the players with the updated statuses.

      • setTime

        public void setTime​(long[] clickTimes,
                    long startTime,
                    Type type,
                    java.util.ArrayList<Player> playerList)
        This method sets the clickTime for the players depending on the type of game they are playing. StopTheTimer needs to save the time that was left after the player's click and QuickAnswer and Thermometer need to save the milliseconds that passed until the player's click in order to gather the needed information for updating the scores later.
        Parameters:
        clickTimes - an array of long variables that stores the system time in milliseconds of the moment that the player answered the question.
        startTime - is the moment that the question appeared on the screen in milliseconds.
        type - the type of round that the players are currently playing.
        playerList - the list of the players.

      • changePoints

        public void changePoints​(Type type)
        Changes the score of all the players depending on the type of round they are currently playing.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the round for the last question.

      • defaultifyPlayers

        public void defaultifyPlayers​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> playerList,
                              Type type)
        Returns all the variables in a player that were changed after each question temporarily to their default state.
        Parameters:
        playerList - the list of all the players
        type - the type of round the question the players just answered belonged to

      • gameEnd

        public void gameEnd​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> playerList)
        When the game ends, this method gets the list of the players and saves their scores in the file if needed.
        Parameters:
        playerList - the list of the players that played the game.
